results.title: All over the shop
results.creator_credit: Peter Pickering, J.D. Chambers, Data Film Productions and European Productivity Agency
results.brief_description: Shows examples of how Work Study has been applied in the reorganization of departments in three different firms. In the packing department of a large pharmaceutical works the flow of work was improved, the individual jobs made easier by the use of simple cheap apparatus made for the purpose. Unnecessary movement of personnel was eliminated in the making-up department of a hosiery firm by adoption of a new layout involving the use of conveyor belts. In the sheet metal shop of an electronic instrument firm, Work Study was used to relieve the shortage of skilled operatives.

results.title: All our futures
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Harold Mantell Inc
results.brief_description: Narrated by Peter Ustinov this film shows the 25 years of service to children by UNICEF. Beginning in 12 European countries where five million children were given food, medicine and clothing during the emergency period after World War II, and then moving - over the years and to many different places - to show its diversified work in many more countries including Africa and Latin America.

results.title: All my own work (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows how new approaches in art education in Victoria can be successfully applied in the classroom. As the new course is child-centred, the film visualises some of the environmental influences that children experience

results.title: All manner of trains
results.brief_description: The capacity, scope, problems and future of Australia’s six State and one Commonwealth railway systems. We accompany a railway worker from Cairns to Perth, by rail, and then visit workshops to see carriages and locomotives being made, and modern methods of mechanised track laying. Specially designed rolling stock is used for stock transport, bulk wheat and sugar moving, transporting cars and semi-trailers, and for moving timber. No other credits available.

results.title: All lit up
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Joy Batchelor and Gas Council
results.brief_description: An exhilarating presentation of the story of the use of fire for warmth and comfort since the days of the Romans. Shows something of the inherent problems that have persisted until today; with the use of an ingenious yet simple invention, the major difficulties have been solved.

results.title: All about weightlessness: the astronaut's dilemma
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Dr Heinz Haber uses a specially created cartoon character, Homo-Sapiens-Extrater-Restrialis, to explain the hazards of survival in the strange environment of outer space. Man must become conditioned to living in a state of weightlessness for long periods. Eating presents some new and surprising problems; sleeping will be a unique experience. We do not know how man’s subconscious mind will react to prolonged journeying through space. An excerpt from “Man in space”.

results.title: All about ships
results.creator_credit: George Klein and South Australia. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: An animated film depicting the evolution of ships from the log raft to the development of the nuclear powered vessel. This story of ships includes the early problems of navigation and ship building and portrays human endeavours to improve sea transport in all parts of the world.

results.title: All about Bobby
results.creator_credit: Brad Stanley and Arthur Barr Productions
results.brief_description: Clearly, no one knows about twelve-year-old Bobby Ramirez, although each person questioned has their own opinion and impression of the boy. All of those impressions, and others are voice over film clips which show him going about his regular activities and refuting right and left views of the people who think they know him. A stimulating film which leads to an investigation into what and who each of us is.

results.title: Alimentary tract
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Intended as a supplement to Digestion of foods, this film treats in detail, motility phenomena of the gastro-intestinal tract. Actual photography reveals different types of movements in the stomach, such as hypermotility, inhibition, antiperistalsis, hunger contractions and normal movements.

results.title: Alice through the lift door: the other side of shopping
results.brief_description: A brief history of the various types of stores in Australia from the early market days to the present day large department store and shopping centre complexes. The behind the scenes operations of a department store are described.
